title: Wait what did riot just say?

embed.description: Welcome to League of Legends! Sign up for a free account at http://riot.com/signup This is a short tutorial on how to play League. If you're a new player, this guide will help get you up to speed. If you're a veteran player, consider sharing this with a friend who wants to learn!

body:
"Even the most powerful champions will melt if targeted by one" referring to a turret.

Are we playing the same game?

replies.body: They technically aren't wrong. An ice cube actually takes a really long time to fully melt.
An ice cube set out in a bowl will melt faster than a mundo under a turret...
a rock left in a bowl will melt faster than mundo under a turret...
Fire left in a bowl will melt faster than mundo under a turret...
a Mundo left in a bowl will melt faster than a bowl under a turret..
This joke has gone on too long. Wrap it up kids.

A mundo left under a wrap will melt a turret faster than a bowl.

Wait, what?
Turrets are just paper tigers in general, useless automatons meant to give enemies gold and deny you farm lmfao
Have they seen a full tank Galio sit under turret with his W on him? Turrets don't do anything lol.

> [{quoted}](name=A Miss Fortune,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VPpl1bGE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-12-30T00:21:54.879+0000)
>
> Have they seen a full tank Galio sit under turret with his W on him? Turrets don't do anything lol.

Incorrect. They actually heal him.
Wait.. What's a Galio?
If I remember correctly, a Galio is a waterproof overshoe, typically made of rubber.
No no, you're thinking of a galosh. Galio was a language spoken in early Medieval Scotland.
No, no, that's Gaelic. Galio was an Italian astronomer during the Renaissance.
Not quite. Galio is actually a collection of art works set on display in a public forum for viewing.
I believe that's a gallery. I think a Galio refers to an open space in a forest.

My friend, you're mistaken.

Galio was Ash's rival from the early days in pokemon.

Silly, that's Gary!

Galio is *obviously* a money currency used in the fictional setting of Harry Potter.

Come on, that's a Galleon! 
I believe you are talking about Galio, a kitchen on a ship!
You silly billy, that's a galley!  Galio is a volcanic archipelago in the Pacific Ocean!
Somebody lied to you sista. That's the Galapagos. A Galio is the place where they hang people when they execute them!
Thats way off. Galio is the latin term for a gallon.
why do I get the idea that this comment section was staged xD
No, that's obviously a galleta. A Galio is obviously a big conglomerate of stars, planets, asteroids, axions, black holes, neutron stars, dark energy etc.
you are very wrong, a Galio is a carved stone creature often made of granite that  contains spouts that direct water away from the sides of buildings.
{{champion:3}} {{item:3070}}
Summoners Rift has installed several ~~Turrets~~ Laser Pointers at critical choke points to deter enemy offensives.

> [{quoted}](name=Biff Manly,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VPpl1bGE,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-12-30T03:12:23.702+0000)
>
> Summoners Rift has installed several ~~Turrets~~ Laser Pointers at critical choke points to deter enemy offensives.

Well, at least you'll always be safe from {{champion:107}}
Safe from kitty? More like see your death coming
Not if he's a _smart kitty_.
This is a tutorial video. Teaching you not to walk up to a turret to kill it. So yeah try taking a full build vayne to an inhibitor turret with full hp and see who melts.

How about 
AP{{champion:5}} or {{champion:23}} or {{champion:266}} + {{item:3026}}  for 3 tries

*AP Sated
He dies much faster without sated devourer

> [{quoted}](name=Rikari,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VPpl1bGE,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-12-30T03:17:57.219+0000)
>
> This is a tutorial video. Teaching you not to walk up to a turret to kill it. So yeah try taking a full build vayne to an inhibitor turret with full hp and see who melts.

Does the build include armor?
Cause if it does, it might be a close fight.
I don't care how much armor the vayne has the turret will literally always win.

> [{quoted}](name=UltraScept,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VPpl1bGE,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2015-12-30T06:30:10.604+0000)
>
> I don't care how much armor the vayne has the turret will literally always win.

If only that was true.

> [{quoted}](name=Loco Little,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VPpl1bGE,comment-id=0008000000000001,timestamp=2015-12-30T14:17:55.430+0000)
>
> If only that was true.

2.5asp, 200AD, the turret loses all the time.

> [{quoted}](name=Paroe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VPpl1bGE,comment-id=00080000000000010000,timestamp=2015-12-30T14:26:27.622+0000)
>
> 2.5asp, 200AD, the turret loses all the time.

Thats considering you even focus turret, UltraScept seems to believe that the turret winning is the important thing. The main point is the turret doesn't do enough, fast enough. Sure the turret will take out vayne..eventually... after she penta kills your team under it because the tank tanked it for her first.

It used to be that a split push tactic could be avoided because turrets actually protected you, you could fight a 4v5 or even a 3v5 under turret. Now you only have the advantage if it's 5 man under turret, in which case the enemy just doesn't fight and split pushes the other lanes.
Not true lol
i like how they show a lvl 7 lux killing lvl 4 kat and lvl 6 lee killing lvl 3 shyv at beginning
In the old champion spotlights they did this to trick you into thinking a champion didn't have shit damage outputs so Phreak could be all "muh tons of damage". Watch Yorick's spotlight.

Haha! Yeah, that seems to have change lately, huh?

Dives op.

I recall being Jungle Nautilus once on Summoners Rift, both teams were gathered up around the 2nd enemy bot turret and I threw a hook out to grab someone (I believe this was the same game where I could 1v1 the enemy Graves so I was pretty fed).
I proceeded to tank the turret for the entire teamfight, that tower wasn't doing anything to me.
http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zFm97YREBwY/Umd3fG2bCUI/AAAAAAAAOds/eiJcnyZ5TAM/s1600/bender-laughing.gif

> [{quoted}](name=ToxicPrint,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VPpl1bGE,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-12-29T20:04:01.883+0000)
>
> "Even the most powerful champions will melt if targeted by one" referring to a turret.
> 
> Are we playing the same game?

There is still 1 champ who can keep from dying under turret no matter what Riot does (short of removing his heal on 3rd auto attack)...
1.5as
450ap
xin HEALS to full under turrets.
dived a half health nasus lvl 4 as poppy and got a kill and got out before the turret could pop my passive shield. feels good man.
I'm less bothered by the turrets' current damage output and more bothered by how seemingly easy they are to shred.
fuck you riot, I started at the end of season 3, this game gets worse as it goes on, as dunkey said "I'm done with league of legends" (fuck your shitty tutorial aswell)
Thornmail Ashe Kappa
